net.sf.sanity4j.util
Class FileUtil

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.sanity4j.util.FileUtil

public final class FileUtil
extends Object

FileUtil - File related utility methods.

Since:
Sanity4J 1.0
Author:
Yiannis Paschalidis

Method Detail

createDir

public static File createDir(String path)
Creates a directory if it doesn't exist.

Parameters:
path - the directory path.
Returns:
a File Object representing the directory.

findJars

public static void findJars(File base,
                            List<String> jars)
Searches for jar files within the given directory. The full path of each jar will be added to the given list.

Parameters:
base - the base directory
jars - the list of jars to add to

delete

public static void delete(File file)
                   throws IOException
Deletes a file/directory and all its contents.

Parameters:
file - the file to delete.
Throws:
IOException - if the delete fails.

copy

public static void copy(File source,
                        File dest)
                 throws IOException
Copies a file.

Parameters:
source - the source file
dest - the destination file
Throws:
IOException - if there is an error during the copy.

read

public static byte[] read(File file)
                   throws IOException
Reads the entire binary contents of the given file.

Parameters:
file - the file to read from
Returns:
the binary content of the given file.
Throws:
IOException - if there is an error reading from the file.

writeToFile

public static void writeToFile(String string,
                               File file)
                        throws IOException
Writes a string to a file in UTF-8. Parent directories will be created.

Parameters:
string - the String to write
file - the File to write to
Throws:
IOException - if there is an error writing to the file

flattenClasspath

public static String flattenClasspath(List<String> jarList,
                                      String classpath)
Flattens a list of jars into a classpth. If an exitsing classpath is provided, then the new list is appended to the end of the old classpath.

Parameters:
jarList - the list of jars to flatten.
classpath - an existing classpath to append to, can be null.
Returns:
the flattened classpath.

hasValue

public static boolean hasValue(String str)
Evaluates a string for emptiness.

Parameters:
str - the string to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the string is non-null and has a trimmed length greater than zero.
